name: commands
description: Run one/multiple commands with arguments from Tree View / Status Bar / Quick Pick.

commands.commands.description: Main extension property. Commands that will be rendered in the View.

commands.workspaceCommands.description: Commands that will be rendered in the View, specific to the workspace.

commands.alias.markdownDescription: Use shorter command ids. Extension registers aliased commands so that they can be also used in keybindings.

commands.cycle.markdownDescription: Register a new command (id will be `commands.cycle.${OBJECT_KEY}`) that runs one command from the list. If the last command was the last item on the list then run the first command from the list.

commands.showKeybindings.markdownDescription: Whether or not to show keyboard shortcuts assigned to command contributed by user. (Currently only displayed in Tree View).

commands.treeViewCollapseFolders.description: Collapse folders by default. Requires reload before being applied.

commands.treeViewStatusBarVisibleSymbol.markdownDescription: Symbol used in the tree view to indicate that command is also visible in the status bar.

commands.treeViewStatusBarInvisibleSymbo.markdownDescription: Symbol used in the tree view to indicate that status bar item exists but is invisible (`"hidden": true,`).

commands.treeViewWorkspaceCommandSymbol.markdownDescription: Symbol used in the tree view to indicate workspace command (from `#commands.workspaceCommands#`) setting.

commands.statusBarDefaultText.description: Controls the text of Status Bar item when adding from Tree View context menu.

commands.statusBarDefaultPosition.description: Where to put command on Status Bar (left or right).

commands.quickPickIncludeAllCommands.markdownDescription: When checked - include all commands from Command Palette to the Quick Pick.

commands.populateCommandPalette.markdownDescription: Adds all items to Command Palette (Requires editor reload after every change of main config `#commands.commands#`).

commands.documentLinksEnabled.markdownDescription:
Run commands as links in documents. Links have format `@command?args@`.

[issues/2](https://github.com/usernamehw/vscode-commands/issues/2)

commands.documentLinksPattern.markdownDescription: [Glob](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/glob-patterns) for `#commands.documentLinksEnabled#`. Example: `**/*.{ts,js}` - only enable in TypeScript & JavaScript files.

commands.toggleSettings.showNotification.markdownDescription: When enabled - show notification after using `commands.toggleSetting` or `commands.incrementSetting`.

commands.watchTerminalStatusBar.markdownDescription: Enable status bar indicator that is supposed to show the status of a running in terminal command (`dev` | `watch`...). Will only work with contributed terminal profile `Commands:Watch`. Status of errors might not be perfect because it relies on simple text match.

defaultText.markdownDescription: Text when no command in running in target terminal.

errorText.markdownDescription: Text when terminal output matches with `errorWhen`.

warningText.markdownDescription: Text when terminal output matches with `warningWhen`.

successText.markdownDescription: Text when terminal output doesn't match anything from `errorWhen` and `warningWhen`.

commandOnClick.markdownDescription: Command to run when clicking on status bar item when nothing is running.

commandOnClickWhenRunning.markdownDescription: Command to run when clicking on status bar item when terminal has a running command. Accepts: `showTerminal` | `killTerminal` | ANY_COMMAND_ID

sendText.markdownDescription: Text to send to terminal when clicking on status bar item.

showTerminal.markdownDescription: Reveal terminal right after its creation.

terminalIconColor.markdownDescription: Change codicon color for terminal icon.

errorWhen.markdownDescription: Match output of terminal to show status bar item with error state. Can be picked with someting more specific like `\x1b[31m\x1b[1mERROR` (whatever build system shows as errors for your programming language).

warningWhen.markdownDescription: Match output of terminal to show status bar item with warning state. Can be picked with someting more specific like `\x1b[31m\x1b[1mERROR` (whatever build system shows as errors for your programming language).

successWhen.markdownDescription: Set precise condition when state is `success`. By default: if output doesn't match `errorWhen` & `warningWhen` => then the state will be success. It may not be true in case of loading or some error occurring that is not in the `errorWhen` array. When this array is not empty => success state will only be when output matches one of the array items of this setting. Example when running TypeScript compiler with `--watch` flag `tsc --watch` - the success string would be `Found 0 errors`.

highlightErrorWithBackground.markdownDescription: Highlight status bar item with background color (usually red).

highlightWarningWithBackground.markdownDescription: Highlight status bar item with background color (usually orange).

tooltipEnabled.markdownDescription: Enable hover tooltip for status bar item.

replaceInTooltip.markdownDescription: Replace text in status bar hover. (key - regex|string, value - replace text).Use \`/REGEX_TEXT/REGEX_FLAGS\` key for Regular Expression. Any other key would be considered plain text.

alignment.markdownDescription: Pick alignment for status bar item: left/right.

priority.markdownDescription: The priority of the status bar item. Higher values mean the item should be shown more to the left.
